   20: -module(inet_sockopt_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   24: 
   25: 
   26: -define(C_GET_IPPROTO_TCP,1).
   27: -define(C_GET_IPPROTO_IP,2).
   28: -define(C_GET_SOL_SOCKET,3).
   29: -define(C_GET_SOL_IP,4).
   30: 
   31: -define(C_GET_TCP_KEEPIDLE,11).
   32: -define(C_GET_TCP_LINGER2,12).
   33: -define(C_GET_TCP_INFO,13).
   34: -define(C_GET_SO_REUSEADDR,14).
   35: -define(C_GET_SO_KEEPALIVE,15).
   36: -define(C_GET_SO_LINGER,16).
   37: -define(C_GET_SO_DONTROUTE,17).
   38: 
   39: -define(C_GET_LINGER_SIZE,21).
   40: -define(C_GET_TCP_INFO_SIZE,22).
   41: 
   42: -define(C_GET_OFF_LINGER_L_ONOFF,31).
   43: -define(C_GET_OFF_LINGER_L_LINGER,32).
   44: -define(C_GET_OFF_TCPI_SACKED,33).
   45: -define(C_GET_OFF_TCPI_OPTIONS,34).
   46: 
   47: -define(C_GET_SIZ_LINGER_L_ONOFF,41).
   48: -define(C_GET_SIZ_LINGER_L_LINGER,42).
   49: -define(C_GET_SIZ_TCPI_SACKED,43).
   50: -define(C_GET_SIZ_TCPI_OPTIONS,44).
   51: 
   52: -define(C_QUIT,99).
   53: 
   54: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0,
   55:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   56: 	 init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   57:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   58: 	 
   59:          simple/1,
   60:          loop_all/1,
   61:          simple_raw/1, simple_raw_getbin/1, 
   62: 	 multiple_raw/1, multiple_raw_getbin/1,
   63: 	 doc_examples_raw/1, doc_examples_raw_getbin/1,
   64: 	 large_raw/1, large_raw_getbin/1,
   65:          combined/1, combined_getbin/1,
   66: 	 ipv6_v6only_udp/1, ipv6_v6only_tcp/1, ipv6_v6only_sctp/1,
   67: 	 use_ipv6_v6only_udp/1,
   68: 	 type_errors/1,
   69:          windows_reuseaddr/1]).
   70: 
   71: 
   72: suite() ->
   73:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   74:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   75: 
   76: all() -> 
   77:     %% This is a temporary measure to ensure that we can 
   78:     %% test the socket backend without effecting *all*
   79:     %% applications on *all* machines.
   80:     %% This flag is set only for *one* host.
   81:     case ?TEST_INET_BACKENDS() of
   82:         true ->
   83:             [
   84:              {group, inet_backend_default},
   85:              {group, inet_backend_inet},
   86:              {group, inet_backend_socket}
   87:             ];
   88:         _ ->
   89:             [
   90:              {group, inet_backend_default}
   91:             ]
   92:     end.
   93: 
   94: 
   95: groups() -> 
   96:     [
   97:      {inet_backend_default,   [], inet_backend_default_cases()},
   98:      {inet_backend_inet,      [], inet_backend_inet_cases()},
   99:      {inet_backend_socket,    [], inet_backend_socket_cases()}
  100:     ].
  101: 
  102: inet_backend_default_cases() ->
  103:     all_std_cases().
  104: 
  105: inet_backend_inet_cases() ->
  106:     all_std_cases().
  107: 
  108: inet_backend_socket_cases() ->
  109:     all_std_cases().
  110: 
  111: all_std_cases() ->
  112:     [
  113:      simple,
  114:      loop_all,
  115:      simple_raw, simple_raw_getbin,
  116:      multiple_raw, multiple_raw_getbin,
  117:      doc_examples_raw, doc_examples_raw_getbin,
  118:      large_raw, large_raw_getbin,
  119:      combined, combined_getbin,
  120:      ipv6_v6only_udp, ipv6_v6only_tcp, ipv6_v6only_sctp,
  121:      use_ipv6_v6only_udp,
  122:      type_errors,
  123:      windows_reuseaddr
  124:     ].
  125: 
  126: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  127: 
  128:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  129:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  130:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  131: 
  132:     case ?LIB:init_per_suite([{allow_skip, false} | Config0]) of
  133:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  134:             SKIP;
  135: 
  136:         Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  137:             
  138:             %% We need a monitor on this node also
  139:             kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  140: 
  141:             ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  142:                "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  143: 
  144:             Config1
  145:     end.
  146: 
  147: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  148: 
  149:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  150:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  151:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  152: 
  153:     %% Stop the local monitor
  154:     ?P("init_per_suite -> try stop system monitor"),
  155:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  156: 
  157:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  158: 
  159:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  160:             "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  161: 
  162:     Config1.
  163: 
  164: init_per_group(inet_backend_default = _GroupName, Config) ->
  165:     [{socket_create_opts, []} | Config];
  166: init_per_group(inet_backend_inet = _GroupName, Config) ->
  167:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  168:         true ->
  169:             %% The environment trumps us,
  170:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  171:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  172:         false ->
  173:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, inet}]} | Config]
  174:     end;
  175: init_per_group(inet_backend_socket = _GroupName, Config) ->
  176:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  177:         true ->
  178:             %% The environment trumps us,
  179:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  180:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  181:         false ->
  182:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, socket}]} | Config]
  183:     end;
  184: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  185:     Config.
  186: 
  187: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  188:     Config.
  189: 
  190: 
  191: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  192:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  193:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  194:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  195:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  196:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  197:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  198: 
  199:     kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:reset_events(),
  200: 
  201:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  202:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  203:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  204:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  205:     Config.
  206: 
  207: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  208:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  209:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  210:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  211:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  212:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  213:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  214: 
  215:     ?P("system events during test: "
  216:        "~n   ~p", [kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:events()]),
  217: 
  218:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  219:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  220:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  221:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  222:     ok.
  223: 
  224: %% Test inet:setopt/getopt simple functionality.
  225: simple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  226:     Cond = fun() ->
  227:                    %% case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  228:                    %%     true ->
  229:                    %%         {skip, "'nopush' opt not (yet) implemented"};
  230:                    %%     false ->
  231:                    %%         ok
  232:                    %% end
  233:                    ok
  234:            end,
  235:     Pre  = fun() -> #{} end,
  236:     Case = fun(State) -> do_simple(Config, State) end,
  237:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  238:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
  239: 
  240: 
  241: do_simple(Config, _) when is_list(Config) ->
  242:     ?P("begin"),
  243:     XOpts = case os:type() of
  244:                 {unix,_} -> [{reuseaddr,true}];
  245:                 _ -> []
  246:             end,
  247:     Opts      = [{nodelay,   true},
  248:                  {keepalive, true},
  249:                  {packet,    4},
  250:                  {active,    false} | XOpts],
  251:     Tags   = [X || {X,_} <- Opts],
  252: 
  253:     ?P("create socket pair"),
  254:     {S1, S2}  = create_socketpair(Config, Opts, Opts),
  255:     ?P("socket pair created: "
  256:        "~n   S1:      ~p"
  257:        "~n   S1 info: ~p"
  258:        "~n   S2:      ~p"
  259:        "~n   S2 info: ~p", [S1, inet:info(S1), S2, inet:info(S2)]),
  260: 
  261:     ?P("S1: get options: "
  262:        "~n   ~p", [Tags]),
  263:     case inet:getopts(S1, Tags) of
  264:         {ok, Opts} ->
  265:             ?P("S1 (getopts) success");
  266:         {ok, Opts_S1_Invalid_1} ->
  267:             ?P("S1 incorrect (getopts) success: "
  268:                "~n  Expected opts:          ~p"
  269:                "~n  UnExpected opts:        ~p"
  270:                "~n  Exp Opts -- UnExp Opts: ~p"
  271:                "~n  UnExp Opts -- Exp Opts: ~p",
  272:                [Opts, Opts_S1_Invalid_1,
  273:                 Opts -- Opts_S1_Invalid_1,
  274:                 Opts_S1_Invalid_1 -- Opts]),
  275:             ct:fail({incorrect_success, s1, 1, Opts, Opts_S1_Invalid_1});
  276:         {error, Reason_S1_1} ->
  277:             ?P("<ERROR> Failed get S1 options: "
  278:                "~n  Reason: ~p", [Reason_S1_1]),
  279:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, s1, 1, Reason_S1_1})
  280:     end,
  281: 
  282:     ?P("S2: get options: "
  283:        "~n   ~p", [Tags]),
  284:     case inet:getopts(S2, Tags) of
  285:         {ok, Opts} ->
  286:             ?P("S2 (getopts) success");
  287:         {ok, Opts_S2_Invalid_1} ->
  288:             ?P("S2 incorrect (getopts) success: "
  289:                "~n  Expected opts:   ~p"
  290:                "~n  UnExpected opts: ~p", [Opts, Opts_S2_Invalid_1]),
  291:             ct:fail({incorrect_success, s2, 1, Opts, Opts_S2_Invalid_1});
  292:         {error, Reason_S2_1} ->
  293:             ?P("<ERROR> Failed get S2 options: "
  294:                "~n  Reason: ~p", [Reason_S2_1]),
  295:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, s2, 1, Reason_S2_1})
  296:     end,
  297: 
  298:     NoPushOpt = case os:type() of
  299:                     {unix, Osname} when Osname =:= linux;
  300:                                         Osname =:= freebsd -> {nopush, true};
  301:                     {_,_} -> {nopush, false}
  302:                 end,
  303:     COpt = [{X,case X of nodelay -> false;_ -> Y end} ||
  304:                {X,Y} <- [NoPushOpt|Opts]],
  305:     COptTags = [X || {X,_} <- COpt],
  306:     ?P("S1: set options:"
  307:        "~n   ~p", [COpt]),
  308:     inet:setopts(S1,COpt),
  309: 
  310:     ?P("S1: get options: "
  311:        "~n   ~p", [COptTags]),
  312:     case inet:getopts(S1, COptTags) of
  313:         {ok, COpt} ->
  314:             ?P("S1: (getopts) success"),
  315:             ok;
  316:         {ok, COptErr_S1} ->
  317:             ?P("S1: incorrect (getopts) success:"
  318:                "~n   Expected: ~p"
  319:                "~n   Received: ~p", [COpt, COptErr_S1]),
  320:             ct:fail({incorrect_success, s1, 2, COpt, COptErr_S1});
  321:         {error, Reason_S1_2} ->
  322:             ?P("S1: unexpected failure:"
  323:                "~n   ~p", [Reason_S1_2]),
  324:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, s1, 2, Reason_S1_2})
  325:     end,
  326: 
  327:     ?P("S2: get options: "
  328:        "~n   ~p", [Tags]),
  329:     case inet:getopts(S2,Tags) of
  330:         {ok, Opts} ->
  331:             ?P("S2: (getopts) success"),
  332:             ok;
  333:         {ok, OptErr_S2} ->
  334:             ?P("S2: incorrect (getopts) success:"
  335:                "~n   Expected: ~p"
  336:                "~n   Received: ~p", [Opts, OptErr_S2]),
  337:             ct:fail({incorrect_success, s2, 2, Opts, OptErr_S2});
  338:         {error, Reason_S2_2} ->
  339:             ?P("S2: unexpected failure:"
  340:                "~n   ~p", [Reason_S2_2]),
  341:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, s2, 2, Reason_S2_2})
  342:     end,
  343: 
  344:     ?P("cleanup"),
  345:     gen_tcp:close(S1),
  346:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  347: 
  348:     ?P("done"),
  349:     ok.
  350: 
  351: %% Loop through all socket options and check that they work.
  352: loop_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  353:     Cond = fun() ->
  354:                    case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  355:                        true ->
  356:                            {skip, "Watermark options not (yet) implemented"};
  357:                        false ->
  358:                            ok
  359:                    end
  360:            end,
  361:     Pre  = fun() -> #{} end,
  362:     Case = fun(State) -> do_loop_all(Config, State) end,
  363:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  364:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
  365: 
  366: do_loop_all(Config, _) ->
  367:     ListenFailures =
  368: 	lists:foldr(make_check_fun(Config, listen),[],all_listen_options()),
  369:     AcceptFailures =
  370: 	lists:foldr(make_check_fun(Config, accept),[],all_accept_options()),
  371:     ConnectFailures =
  372: 	lists:foldr(make_check_fun(Config, connect),[],all_connect_options()),
  373:     UdpFailures =
  374: 	lists:foldr(make_check_fun(Config),[],all_udp_options()),
  375:     case ListenFailures++AcceptFailures++ConnectFailures++UdpFailures of
  376: 	[] ->
  377: 	    ok;
  378: 	Failed ->
  379: 	    {comment,lists:flatten(
  380: 		       io_lib:format("Non mandatory failed:~w",
  381: 				     [Failed]))}
  382:     end.
  383: 
  384: 
  385: 
  386: %% Test simple setopt/getopt of raw options.
  387: simple_raw(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  388:     do_simple_raw(Config, false).
  389: 
  390: %% Test simple setopt/getopt of raw options, with binaries in getopt.
  391: simple_raw_getbin(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  392:     do_simple_raw(Config, true).
  393: 
  394: do_simple_raw(Config, Binary) when is_list(Config) ->
  395:     Port = start_helper(Config),
  396:     SolSocket = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SOL_SOCKET),
  397:     SoKeepAlive = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SO_KEEPALIVE),
  398:     OptionTrue = {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,<<1:32/native>>},
  399:     OptionFalse = {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,<<0:32/native>>},
  400:     {S1,S2} = create_socketpair(Config, [OptionTrue],[{keepalive,true}]),
  401:     {ok,[{keepalive,true}]} = inet:getopts(S1,[keepalive]),
  402:     {ok,[{keepalive,true}]} = inet:getopts(S2,[keepalive]),
  403:     {ok,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,X1B}]} =
  404: 	inet:getopts(S1,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,binarify(4,Binary)}]),
  405:     X1 = nintbin2int(X1B),
  406:     {ok,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,X2B}]} =
  407: 	inet:getopts(S2,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,binarify(4,Binary)}]),
  408:     X2 = nintbin2int(X2B),
  409:     true = X1 > 0,
  410:     true = X2 > 0,
  411:     inet:setopts(S1,[{keepalive,false}]),
  412:     inet:setopts(S2,[OptionFalse]),
  413:     {ok,[{keepalive,false}]} = inet:getopts(S1,[keepalive]),
  414:     {ok,[{keepalive,false}]} = inet:getopts(S2,[keepalive]),
  415:     {ok,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,Y1B}]} =
  416: 	inet:getopts(S1,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,binarify(4,Binary)}]),
  417:     Y1 = nintbin2int(Y1B),
  418:     {ok,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,Y2B}]} =
  419: 	inet:getopts(S2,[{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepAlive,binarify(4,Binary)}]),
  420:     Y2 = nintbin2int(Y2B),
  421:     true = Y1 == 0,
  422:     true = Y2 == 0,
  423:     gen_tcp:close(S1),
  424:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  425:     stop_helper(Port),
  426:     ok.
  427: 
  428: nintbin2int(<<Int:32/native>>) -> Int;
  429: nintbin2int(<<Int:24/native>>) -> Int;
  430: nintbin2int(<<Int:16/native>>) -> Int;
  431: nintbin2int(<<Int:8/native>>) -> Int;
  432: nintbin2int(<<>>) -> 0.
  433: 
  434: 
  435: 
  436: %% Test setopt/getopt of multiple raw options.
  437: multiple_raw(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  438:     Cond = fun() -> is_not_openbsd() end,
  439:     Pre  = fun() -> false end,
  440:     Case = fun(State) -> do_multiple_raw(Config, State) end,
  441:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  442:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
  443:     
  444: 
  445: %% Test setopt/getopt of multiple raw options, with binaries in
  446: %% getopt.
  447: multiple_raw_getbin(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  448:     Cond = fun() -> is_not_openbsd() end,
  449:     Pre  = fun() -> true end,
  450:     Case = fun(State) -> do_multiple_raw(Config, State) end,
  451:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  452:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
  453: 
  454: do_multiple_raw(Config, Binary) ->
  455:     Port             = start_helper(Config),
  456:     SolSocket        = ask_helper(Port, ?C_GET_SOL_SOCKET),
  457:     SoKeepalive      = ask_helper(Port, ?C_GET_SO_KEEPALIVE),
  458:     SoKeepaliveTrue  = {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,<<1:32/native>>},
  459:     SoKeepaliveFalse = {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,<<0:32/native>>},
  460:     SoDontroute      = ask_helper(Port, ?C_GET_SO_DONTROUTE),
  461:     SoDontrouteTrue  = {raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,<<1:32/native>>},
  462:     SoDontrouteFalse = {raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,<<0:32/native>>},
  463:     {S1,S2} =
  464: 	create_socketpair(
  465:           Config,
  466: 	  [SoDontrouteFalse,SoKeepaliveTrue],
  467: 	  [SoKeepaliveFalse,SoDontrouteTrue]),
  468:     {ok,[{dontroute,false},{keepalive,true}]} =
  469: 	inet:getopts(S1, [dontroute,keepalive]),
  470:     {ok,
  471:      [{raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,S1R1},
  472:       {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,S1K1}]} =
  473: 	inet:getopts(
  474: 	  S1,
  475: 	  [{raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,binarify(4, Binary)},
  476: 	   {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,binarify(4, Binary)}]),
  477:     true = nintbin2int(S1R1) =:= 0,
  478:     true = nintbin2int(S1K1) =/= 0,
  479:     {ok,[{keepalive,false},{dontroute,true}]} =
  480: 	inet:getopts(S2, [keepalive,dontroute]),
  481:     {ok,
  482:      [{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,S2K1},
  483:       {raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,S2R1}]} =
  484: 	inet:getopts(
  485: 	  S2,
  486: 	  [{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,binarify(4, Binary)},
  487: 	   {raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,binarify(4, Binary)}]),
  488:     true = nintbin2int(S2K1) =:= 0,
  489:     true = nintbin2int(S2R1) =/= 0,
  490:     %%
  491:     ok = inet:setopts(
  492: 	   S1, [SoDontrouteTrue,SoKeepaliveFalse]),
  493:     ok = inet:setopts(
  494: 	   S2, [SoKeepaliveTrue,SoDontrouteFalse]),
  495:     {ok,
  496:      [{raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,S1R2},
  497:       {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,S1K2}]} =
  498: 	inet:getopts(
  499: 	  S1,
  500: 	  [{raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,binarify(4, Binary)},
  501: 	   {raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,binarify(4, Binary)}]),
  502:     true = nintbin2int(S1R2) =/= 0,
  503:     true = nintbin2int(S1K2) =:= 0,
  504:     {ok,
  505:      [{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,S2K2},
  506:       {raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,S2R2}]} =
  507: 	inet:getopts(
  508: 	  S2,
  509: 	  [{raw,SolSocket,SoKeepalive,binarify(4, Binary)},
  510: 	   {raw,SolSocket,SoDontroute,binarify(4, Binary)}]),
  511:     true = nintbin2int(S2K2) =/= 0,
  512:     true = nintbin2int(S2R2) =:= 0,
  513:     %%
  514:     gen_tcp:close(S1),
  515:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  516:     stop_helper(Port),
  517:     ok.
  518: 
  519: 
  520: 
  521: %% Test that the example code from the documentation works.
  522: doc_examples_raw(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  523:     do_doc_examples_raw(Config, false).
  524: 
  525: %% Test that the example code from the documentation works when getopt
  526: %% uses binaries.
  527: doc_examples_raw_getbin(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  528:     do_doc_examples_raw(Config,true).
  529: 
  530: do_doc_examples_raw(Config, Binary) when is_list(Config) ->
  531:     Port              = start_helper(Config),
  532:     Proto             = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_IPPROTO_TCP),
  533:     TcpInfo           = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_TCP_INFO),
  534:     TcpInfoSize       = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_TCP_INFO_SIZE),
  535:     TcpiSackedOffset  = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_OFF_TCPI_SACKED),
  536:     TcpiOptionsOffset = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_OFF_TCPI_OPTIONS),
  537:     TcpiSackedSize    = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SIZ_TCPI_SACKED),
  538:     TcpiOptionsSize   = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SIZ_TCPI_OPTIONS),
  539:     TcpLinger2        = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_TCP_LINGER2),
  540:     stop_helper(Port),
  541:     case all_ok([Proto,TcpInfo,TcpInfoSize,TcpiSackedOffset,
  542: 		 TcpiOptionsOffset,TcpiSackedSize,TcpiOptionsSize,
  543: 		 TcpLinger2]) of
  544: 	false ->
  545: 	    {skipped,"Does not run on this OS."};
  546: 	true ->
  547: 	    {Sock,I} = create_socketpair(Config, [], []),
  548: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,<<OrigLinger:32/native>>}]} =
  549: 		inet:getopts(Sock,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,binarify(4,Binary)}]),
  550: 	    NewLinger = OrigLinger div 2,
  551: 	    ok = inet:setopts(Sock,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,
  552: 				     <<NewLinger:32/native>>}]),
  553: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,<<NewLinger:32/native>>}]} =
  554: 		inet:getopts(Sock,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,binarify(4,Binary)}]),
  555: 	    ok = inet:setopts(Sock,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,
  556: 				     <<OrigLinger:32/native>>}]),
  557: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,<<OrigLinger:32/native>>}]} =
  558: 		inet:getopts(Sock,[{raw,Proto,TcpLinger2,binarify(4,Binary)}]),
  559: 	    {ok,[{raw,_,_,Info}]} =
  560: 		inet:getopts(Sock,[{raw,Proto,TcpInfo,
  561: 				    binarify(TcpInfoSize,Binary)}]),
  562: 	    Bit1 = TcpiSackedSize * 8,
  563:             <<_:TcpiSackedOffset/binary,
  564: 	      TcpiSacked:Bit1/native,_/binary>> =
  565: 		Info,
  566: 	    0 = TcpiSacked,
  567: 	    Bit2 = TcpiOptionsSize * 8,
  568:             <<_:TcpiOptionsOffset/binary,
  569: 	      TcpiOptions:Bit2/native,_/binary>> =
  570: 		Info,
  571: 	    true = TcpiOptions =/= 0,
  572: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock),
  573: 	    gen_tcp:close(I),
  574: 	    ok
  575:     end.
  576: 
  577: %% Test structs and large/too large buffers when raw.
  578: large_raw(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  579:     do_large_raw(Config,false).
  580: 
  581: %% Test structs and large/too large buffers when raw
  582: %% using binaries to getopts.
  583: large_raw_getbin(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  584:     do_large_raw(Config,true).
  585: 
  586: do_large_raw(Config,Binary) when is_list(Config) ->
  587:     Port = start_helper(Config),
  588:     Proto = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SOL_SOCKET),
  589:     Linger = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SO_LINGER),
  590:     LingerSize = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_LINGER_SIZE),
  591:     LingerOnOffOffset = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_OFF_LINGER_L_ONOFF),
  592:     LingerLingerOffset = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_OFF_LINGER_L_LINGER),
  593:     LingerOnOffSize = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SIZ_LINGER_L_ONOFF),
  594:     LingerLingerSize = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SIZ_LINGER_L_LINGER),
  595:     stop_helper(Port),
  596:     case all_ok([Proto,Linger,LingerSize,LingerOnOffOffset,
  597: 		 LingerLingerOffset,LingerOnOffSize,LingerLingerSize]) of
  598: 	false ->
  599: 	    {skipped,"Does not run on this OS."};
  600: 	true ->
  601: 	    {Sock1,Sock2} = create_socketpair(Config,
  602:                                               [{linger,{true,10}}],
  603: 					      [{linger,{false,0}}]),
  604: 	    LargeSize = 1024,  % Solaris can take up to 1024*9,
  605: 						% linux 1024*63...
  606: 	    TooLargeSize = 1024*64,
  607: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger1}]} =
  608: 		inet:getopts(Sock1,[{raw,Proto,Linger,
  609: 				     binarify(LargeSize,Binary)}]),
  610: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger2}]} =
  611: 		inet:getopts(Sock2,[{raw,Proto,Linger,
  612: 				     binarify(LingerSize,Binary)}]),
  613: 	    true = byte_size(Linger1) =:= LingerSize,
  614: 	    LingerLingerBits = LingerLingerSize * 8,
  615: 	    LingerOnOffBits = LingerOnOffSize * 8,
  616: 	    <<_:LingerLingerOffset/binary,
  617: 	      Ling1:LingerLingerBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger1,
  618: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  619: 	      Off1:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger1,
  620: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  621: 	      Off2:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger2,
  622: 	    true = Off1 =/= 0,
  623: 	    true = Off2 == 0,
  624: 	    true = Ling1 == 10,
  625:             case {?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config),
  626:                   inet:getopts(Sock1,[{raw,Proto,Linger,TooLargeSize}])} of
  627:                 {false, {error,einval}} ->
  628:                     ok;
  629:                 {true,  {ok, _}} ->
  630:                     ok;
  631:                 {_, Unexpected} ->
  632:                     ?P("unexpected result: "
  633:                        "~n   ~p", [Unexpected]),
  634:                     ct:fail({unexpected, Unexpected})
  635:             end,
  636: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock1),
  637: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock2),
  638: 	    ok
  639:     end.
  640: 
  641: %% Test raw structs combined w/ other options .
  642: combined(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  643:     do_combined(Config,false).
  644: 
  645: %% Test raw structs combined w/ other options and
  646: %% binarise in getopts.
  647: combined_getbin(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  648:     do_combined(Config,true).
  649: 
  650: do_combined(Config,Binary) when is_list(Config) ->
  651:     Port = start_helper(Config),
  652:     Proto = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SOL_SOCKET),
  653:     Linger = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SO_LINGER),
  654:     LingerSize = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_LINGER_SIZE),
  655:     LingerOnOffOffset = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_OFF_LINGER_L_ONOFF),
  656:     LingerLingerOffset = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_OFF_LINGER_L_LINGER),
  657:     LingerOnOffSize = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SIZ_LINGER_L_ONOFF),
  658:     LingerLingerSize = ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SIZ_LINGER_L_LINGER),
  659:     stop_helper(Port),
  660:     case all_ok([Proto,Linger,LingerSize,LingerOnOffOffset,
  661: 		 LingerLingerOffset,LingerOnOffSize,LingerLingerSize]) of
  662: 	false ->
  663: 	    {skipped,"Does not run on this OS."};
  664: 	true ->
  665: 	    LingerLingerBits = LingerLingerSize * 8,
  666: 	    LingerOnOffBits = LingerOnOffSize * 8,
  667: 	    {LingerOn,LingerOff} =
  668: 		case LingerOnOffOffset <  LingerLingerOffset of
  669: 		    true ->
  670: 			Pad1 =
  671: 			    list_to_binary(
  672: 			      lists:duplicate(LingerOnOffOffset,
  673: 					      0)),
  674: 			Pad2Siz =
  675: 			    LingerLingerOffset - LingerOnOffSize -
  676: 			    LingerOnOffOffset,
  677: 			Pad2 =
  678: 			    list_to_binary(
  679: 			      lists:duplicate(Pad2Siz,
  680: 					      0)),
  681: 			Pad3Siz = LingerSize - LingerLingerSize -
  682: 			    LingerLingerOffset,
  683: 			Pad3 = list_to_binary(
  684: 				 lists:duplicate(Pad3Siz,
  685: 						 0)),
  686: 			{<<Pad1/binary,1:LingerOnOffBits/native,
  687: 			   Pad2/binary,10:LingerLingerBits/native,
  688: 			   Pad3/binary>>,
  689: 			 <<Pad1/binary,0:LingerOnOffBits/native,
  690: 			   Pad2/binary,0:LingerLingerBits/native,
  691: 			   Pad3/binary>>};
  692: 		    false ->
  693: 			Pad1 =
  694: 			    list_to_binary(
  695: 			      lists:duplicate(LingerLingerOffset,
  696: 					      0)),
  697: 			Pad2Siz =
  698: 			    LingerOnOffOffset - LingerLingerSize -
  699: 			    LingerLingerOffset,
  700: 			Pad2 =
  701: 			    list_to_binary(
  702: 			      lists:duplicate(Pad2Siz,
  703: 					      0)),
  704: 			Pad3Siz = LingerSize - LingerOnOffSize -
  705: 			    LingerOnOffOffset,
  706: 			Pad3 = list_to_binary(
  707: 				 lists:duplicate(Pad3Siz,
  708: 						 0)),
  709: 			{<<Pad1/binary,1:LingerLingerBits/native,
  710: 			   Pad2/binary,10:LingerOnOffBits/native,
  711: 			   Pad3/binary>>,
  712: 			 <<Pad1/binary,0:LingerLingerBits/native,
  713: 			   Pad2/binary,0:LingerOnOffBits/native,
  714: 			   Pad3/binary>>}
  715: 		end,
  716: 	    RawLingerOn = {raw,Proto,Linger,LingerOn},
  717: 	    RawLingerOff = {raw,Proto,Linger,LingerOff},
  718: 	    {Sock1,Sock2} =
  719: 		create_socketpair(Config,
  720:                                   [{keepalive,true},
  721: 				   RawLingerOn],
  722: 				  [{keepalive,false},
  723: 				   RawLingerOff]),
  724: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger1},{keepalive,Keep1}]} =
  725: 		inet:getopts(Sock1,[{raw,Proto,Linger, 
  726: 				     binarify(LingerSize,Binary)},keepalive]),
  727: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger2},{keepalive,Keep2}]} =
  728: 		inet:getopts(Sock2,[{raw,Proto,Linger,
  729: 				     binarify(LingerSize,Binary)},keepalive]),
  730: 	    true = byte_size(Linger1) =:= LingerSize,
  731: 	    <<_:LingerLingerOffset/binary,
  732: 	      Ling1:LingerLingerBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger1,
  733: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  734: 	      Off1:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger1,
  735: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  736: 	      Off2:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger2,
  737: 	    true = Off1 =/= 0,
  738: 	    true = Off2 == 0,
  739: 	    true = Ling1 == 10,
  740: 	    true = Keep1 =:= true,
  741: 	    true = Keep2 =:= false,
  742: 	    {Sock3,Sock4} =
  743: 		create_socketpair(Config,
  744:                                   [RawLingerOn,{keepalive,true}],
  745: 				  [RawLingerOff,{keepalive,false}]),
  746: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger3},{keepalive,Keep3}]} =
  747: 		inet:getopts(Sock3,[{raw,Proto,Linger,
  748: 				     binarify(LingerSize,Binary)},keepalive]),
  749: 	    {ok,[{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger4},{keepalive,Keep4}]} =
  750: 		inet:getopts(Sock4,[{raw,Proto,Linger,
  751: 				     binarify(LingerSize,Binary)},keepalive]),
  752: 	    true = byte_size(Linger3) =:= LingerSize,
  753: 	    <<_:LingerLingerOffset/binary,
  754: 	      Ling3:LingerLingerBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger3,
  755: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  756: 	      Off3:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger3,
  757: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  758: 	      Off4:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger4,
  759: 	    true = Off3 =/= 0,
  760: 	    true = Off4 == 0,
  761: 	    true = Ling3 == 10,
  762: 	    true = Keep3 =:= true,
  763: 	    true = Keep4 =:= false,
  764: 	    {Sock5,Sock6} =
  765: 		create_socketpair(Config,
  766:                                   [{packet,4},RawLingerOn,{keepalive,true}],
  767: 				  [{packet,2},RawLingerOff,{keepalive,false}]),
  768: 	    {ok,[{packet,Pack5},{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger5},
  769: 		 {keepalive,Keep5}]} =
  770: 		inet:getopts(Sock5,[packet,{raw,Proto,Linger,
  771: 					    binarify(LingerSize,Binary)},
  772: 				    keepalive]),
  773: 	    {ok,[{packet,Pack6},{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger6},
  774: 		 {keepalive,Keep6}]} =
  775: 		inet:getopts(Sock6,[packet,{raw,Proto,Linger,
  776: 					    binarify(LingerSize,Binary)},
  777: 				    keepalive]),
  778: 	    true = byte_size(Linger5) =:= LingerSize,
  779: 	    <<_:LingerLingerOffset/binary,
  780: 	      Ling5:LingerLingerBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger5,
  781: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  782: 	      Off5:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger5,
  783: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  784: 	      Off6:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger6,
  785: 	    true = Off5 =/= 0,
  786: 	    true = Off6 == 0,
  787: 	    true = Ling5 == 10,
  788: 	    true = Keep5 =:= true,
  789: 	    true = Keep6 =:= false,
  790: 	    true = Pack5 =:= 4,
  791: 	    true = Pack6 =:= 2,
  792: 	    inet:setopts(Sock6,[{packet,4},RawLingerOn,
  793: 				{keepalive,true}]),
  794: 	    {ok,[{packet,Pack7},{raw,Proto,Linger,Linger7},
  795: 		 {keepalive,Keep7}]} =
  796: 		inet:getopts(Sock6,[packet,{raw,Proto,Linger,
  797: 					    binarify(LingerSize,Binary)},
  798: 				    keepalive]),
  799: 	    <<_:LingerOnOffOffset/binary,
  800: 	      Off7:LingerOnOffBits/native,_/binary>> = Linger7,
  801: 	    true = Off7 =/= 0,
  802: 	    true = Keep7 =:= true,
  803: 	    true = Pack7 =:= 4,
  804: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock1),
  805: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock2),
  806: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock3),
  807: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock4),
  808: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock5),
  809: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock6),
  810: 	    ok
  811:     end.
  812: 
  813: 
  814: 
  815: %% Test socket option ipv6_v6only for UDP.
  816: ipv6_v6only_udp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  817:     ipv6_v6only(Config, gen_udp).
  818: 
  819: %% Test socket option ipv6_v6only for TCP.
  820: ipv6_v6only_tcp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  821:     ipv6_v6only(Config, gen_tcp).
  822: 
  823: %% Test socket option ipv6_v6only for SCTP.
  824: ipv6_v6only_sctp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  825:     ipv6_v6only(Config, gen_sctp).
  826: 
  827: ipv6_v6only(Config, Module) when is_list(Config) ->
  828:     case ipv6_v6only_open(Module, []) of
  829: 	{ok,S1} ->
  830: 	    case inet:getopts(S1, [ipv6_v6only]) of
  831: 		{ok,[{ipv6_v6only,Default}]}
  832: 		  when is_boolean(Default) ->
  833: 		    ok =
  834: 			ipv6_v6only_close(Module, S1),
  835: 		    ipv6_v6only(Config, Module, Default);
  836: 		{ok,[]} ->
  837: 		    io:format("Not implemented.~n", []),
  838: 		    %% This list of OS:es where the option is
  839: 		    %% supposed to be not implemented is just
  840: 		    %% a guess, and may grow with time.
  841: 		    case {os:type(),os:version()} of
  842: 			{{unix,linux},{2,M,_}}
  843: 			  when M =< 4 -> ok
  844: 		    end,
  845: 		    %% At least this should work
  846: 		    {ok,S2} =
  847: 			ipv6_v6only_open(
  848: 			  Module,
  849: 			  [{ipv6_v6only,true}]),
  850: 		    ok =
  851: 			ipv6_v6only_close(Module, S2)
  852: 	    end;
  853: 	{error,_} ->
  854: 	    {skipped,"Socket type not supported"}
  855:     end.
  856: 
  857: ipv6_v6only(Config, Module, Default) when is_list(Config) ->
  858:     io:format("Default ~w.~n", [Default]),
  859:     {ok,S1} =
  860: 	ipv6_v6only_open(Module, [{ipv6_v6only,Default}]),
  861:     {ok,[{ipv6_v6only,Default}]} =
  862: 	inet:getopts(S1, [ipv6_v6only]),
  863:     ok =
  864: 	ipv6_v6only_close(Module, S1),
  865:     NotDefault = not Default,
  866:     case ipv6_v6only_open(Module, [{ipv6_v6only,NotDefault}]) of
  867: 	{ok,S2} ->
  868: 	    io:format("Read-write.~n", []),
  869: 	    {ok,[{ipv6_v6only,NotDefault}]} =
  870: 		inet:getopts(S2, [ipv6_v6only]),
  871: 	    ok;
  872: 	{error,einval} ->
  873: 	    io:format("Read-only.~n", []),
  874: 	    %% This option is known to be read-only and true
  875: 	    %% on Windows and OpenBSD
  876: 	    case os:type() of
  877: 		{unix,openbsd} when Default =:= true -> ok;
  878: 		{win32,_} when Default =:= true -> ok
  879: 	    end
  880:     end.
  881: 
  882: ipv6_v6only_open(Module, Opts) ->
  883:     Module:case Module of
  884: 	       gen_tcp -> listen;
  885: 	       _ -> open
  886: 	   end(0, [inet6|Opts]).
  887: 
  888: ipv6_v6only_close(Module, Socket) ->
  889:     Module:close(Socket).
  890: 
  891: 
  892: %% Test using socket option ipv6_v6only for UDP.
  893: use_ipv6_v6only_udp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  894:     ?TC_TRY(use_ipv6_v6only_udp,
  895: 	    fun() -> do_use_ipv6_v6only_udp(Config) end).
  896: 
  897: do_use_ipv6_v6only_udp(Config) ->
  898:     case gen_udp:open(0, [inet6,{ip,{0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}}, {ipv6_v6only,true}]) of
  899: 	{ok,S6} ->
  900: 	    ?P("IPv6 socket option created - ensure ipv6_v6only"),
  901: 	    case inet:getopts(S6, [ipv6_v6only]) of
  902: 		{ok,[{ipv6_v6only,true}]} ->
  903: 		    use_ipv6_v6only_udp(Config, S6);
  904: 		{ok, Other} ->
  905: 		    ?P("IPv6 socket option created - "
  906: 		       "failed ensuring ipv6_v6only"),
  907: 		    exit({skip, {getopts, Other}})
  908: 	    end;
  909: 	{error, OReason} ->
  910: 	    ?P("failed create IPv6 socket: "
  911: 	       "~n   ~p", [OReason]),
  912: 	    exit({skip, "Socket type not supported"})
  913:     end.
  914: 
  915: use_ipv6_v6only_udp(_Config, S6) ->
  916:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(S6),
  917:     ?P("IPv6 socket port number: ~w", [Port]),
  918:     S4 = case gen_udp:open(Port, [inet]) of
  919: 	     {ok, Sock4} ->
  920: 		 ?P("IPv4 socket created with port number ~w", [Port]),
  921: 		 Sock4;
  922: 	     {error, eaddrinuse = Reason} ->
  923: 		 ?P("failed create IPv4 socket: ~p => skip", [Reason]),
  924: 		 exit({skip, Reason});
  925: 	     {error, Reason} ->
  926: 		 ?P("failed create IPv4 socket: "
  927: 		    "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
  928: 		 ct:fail({failed_open, inet, Reason})
  929: 	 end,
  930:     E6 = " IPv6-echo.",
  931:     E4 = " IPv4-echo.",
  932:     {Sender, MRef} =
  933: 	spawn_monitor(fun () ->
  934: 			      use_ipv6_v6only_udp_sender(Port, E6, E4)
  935: 		      end),
  936:     use_ipv6_v6only_udp_listener(
  937:       S6, S4, E6, E4, Sender, MRef).
  938: 
  939: use_ipv6_v6only_udp_listener(S6, S4, E6, E4, Sender, Mref) ->
  940:     ?P("await upd message"),
  941:     receive
  942: 	{udp,S6,IP,P,Data} ->
  943: 	    ?P("received (IPv6) upd message"),
  944: 	    ok = gen_udp:send(S6, IP, P, [Data|E6]),
  945: 	    use_ipv6_v6only_udp_listener(S6, S4, E6, E4, Sender, Mref);
  946: 	{udp,S4,IP,P,Data} ->
  947: 	    ?P("received (IPv4) upd message"),
  948: 	    ok = gen_udp:send(S4, IP, P, [Data|E4]),
  949: 	    use_ipv6_v6only_udp_listener(S6, S4, E6, E4, Sender, Mref);
  950: 	{'DOWN', Mref,_,_, normal} ->
  951: 	    ?P("received expected normal down message"),
  952: 	    ok;
  953: 	{'DOWN', Mref,_,_, Result} ->
  954: 	    %% Since we are linked we will never arrive here
  955: 	    ?P("received expected down message: "
  956: 	       "~n   ~p", [Result]),
  957: 	    Result;
  958: 	Other ->
  959: 	    ?P("received unexpected message: "
  960: 	       "~n   ~p", [Other]),
  961: 	    exit({failed, {listener_unexpected, Other}})
  962:     end.
  963: 
  964: use_ipv6_v6only_udp_sender(Port, E6, E4) ->
  965:     D6 = "IPv6-send.",
  966:     D4 = "IPv4-send.",
  967:     R6 = D6 ++ E6,
  968:     R4 = D4 ++ E4,
  969:     R6 = sndrcv({0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}, Port, [inet6], D6),
  970:     R4 = sndrcv({127,0,0,1}, Port, [inet], D4),
  971:     ok.
  972: 
  973: sndrcv(Ip, Port, Opts, Data) ->
  974:     {ok,S} = gen_udp:open(0, Opts),
  975:     ?P("[~w:~w] ! ~s", [Ip, Port, Data]),
  976:     ok = gen_udp:send(S, Ip, Port, Data),
  977:     receive
  978: 	{udp, S, Ip, Port, RecData} ->
  979: 	    ?P("[~w:~w] : ~s", [Ip, Port, RecData]),
  980: 	    RecData;
  981: 	Other ->
  982: 	    ?P("received unexpected message: "
  983: 	       "~n   ~p", [Other]),
  984: 	    exit({failed, {sndrcv_unexpectec, Other}})
  985:     end.
  986: 
  987: 
  988: 
  989: %% Test that raw data requests are not executed for bad types.
  990: type_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  991:     BadSetOptions =
  992: 	[
  993: 	 {raw,x,3,<<1:32>>},
  994: 	 {raw,1,tre,<<1:32>>},
  995: 	 {raw,1,3,ko},
  996: 	 {raw,1,3,5},
  997: 	 {raw,1,3},
  998: 	 {raw,1},
  999: 	 {raw},
 1000: 	 {raw,ett},
 1001: 	 {raw,ett,tre},
 1002: 	 {raw,{true,10}},
 1003: 	 {raw,{ett,tre,<<1:32>>}},
 1004: 	 {rav,1,3,<<1:32>>},
 1005: 	 raw,
 1006: 	 rav,
 1007: 	 {linger,banan}
 1008: 	],
 1009:     BadGetOptions =
 1010: 	[
 1011: 	 {raw,x,3,<<1:32>>},
 1012: 	 {raw,1,tre,<<1:32>>},
 1013: 	 {raw,1,3,ko},
 1014: 	 {raw,1,3,5.1},
 1015: 	 {raw,1,3,-3},
 1016: 	 {raw,1,3},
 1017: 	 {raw,1},
 1018: 	 {raw},
 1019: 	 {raw,ett},
 1020: 	 {raw,ett,tre},
 1021: 	 {raw,{true,10}},
 1022: 	 {raw,{ett,tre,<<1:32>>}},
 1023: 	 {rav,1,3,<<1:32>>},
 1024: 	 raw,
 1025: 	 rav,
 1026: 	 {linger,banan}
 1027: 	],
 1028:     lists:foreach(fun(Option) ->
 1029: 			  case
 1030: 			      catch create_socketpair(Config, [Option], []) of
 1031: 			      {'EXIT',badarg} ->
 1032: 				  ok;
 1033: 			      Unexpected1 ->
 1034: 				  exit({unexpected,
 1035: 					Unexpected1})
 1036: 			  end,
 1037: 			  case
 1038: 			      catch create_socketpair(Config, [], [Option]) of
 1039: 			      {'EXIT', badarg} ->
 1040: 				  ok;
 1041: 			      Unexpected2 ->
 1042: 				  exit({unexpected,
 1043: 					Unexpected2})
 1044: 			  end,
 1045: 			  {Sock1,Sock2} = create_socketpair(Config, [], []),
 1046: 			  case inet:setopts(Sock1, [Option]) of
 1047: 			      {error, einval} ->
 1048: 				  ok;
 1049: 			      Unexpected3 ->
 1050: 				  exit({unexpected,
 1051: 					Unexpected3})
 1052: 			  end,
 1053: 			  gen_tcp:close(Sock1),
 1054: 			  gen_tcp:close(Sock2)
 1055: 		  end,BadSetOptions),
 1056:     {Sock1,Sock2} = create_socketpair(Config, [], []),
 1057:     lists:foreach(fun(Option) ->
 1058: 			  case inet:getopts(Sock1, [Option]) of
 1059: 			      {error, einval} ->
 1060: 				  ok;
 1061: 			      Unexpected ->
 1062: 				  exit({unexpected,
 1063: 					Unexpected})
 1064: 			  end
 1065: 		  end,BadGetOptions),
 1066:     gen_tcp:close(Sock1),
 1067:     gen_tcp:close(Sock2),
 1068:     ok.
 1069: 
 1070: windows_reuseaddr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1071:     %% Check that emulation of reuseaddr and reuseport on Windows
 1072:     %% works as expected. That is, only set SO_REUSEADDR if both
 1073:     %% reuseaddr and reuseport are set.
 1074:     case os:type() of
 1075:         {win32, _} ->
 1076:             Port = start_helper(Config),
 1077:             Def = {ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SOL_SOCKET),
 1078:                    ask_helper(Port,?C_GET_SO_REUSEADDR)},
 1079:             stop_helper(Port),
 1080:             {false, false} = windows_reuseaddr_test(Config,
 1081:                                                     Def,
 1082:                                                     [{reuseaddr,false},{reuseport,false}],
 1083:                                                     [{reuseaddr,false},{reuseport,false}]),
 1084:             {false, false} = windows_reuseaddr_test(Config,
 1085:                                                     Def,
 1086:                                                     [{reuseaddr,true},{reuseport,false}],
 1087:                                                     [{reuseaddr,true},{reuseport,false}]),
 1088:             {false, false} = windows_reuseaddr_test(Config,
 1089:                                                     Def,
 1090:                                                     [{reuseaddr,false},{reuseport,true}],
 1091:                                                     [{reuseaddr,false},{reuseport,true}]),
 1092:             {true, true} = windows_reuseaddr_test(Config,
 1093:                                                   Def,
 1094:                                                   [{reuseaddr,true},{reuseport,true}],
 1095:                                                   [{reuseaddr,true},{reuseport,true}]),
 1096:             ok;
 1097:         _ ->
 1098:             {skipped, "Test for Windows only"}
 1099:     end.
 1100: 
 1101: windows_reuseaddr_test(Config, {SolSocket, SoReuseaddr}, LOpts, COpts) ->
 1102:     OptNames = fun (Opts) ->
 1103:                        lists:map(fun ({Name,_}) -> Name end, Opts)
 1104:                end,
 1105:     {L,A,C} = create_socketpair_init(Config, LOpts, COpts),
 1106:     {ok, LOpts} = inet:getopts(L, OptNames(LOpts)),
 1107:     {ok, COpts} = inet:getopts(L, OptNames(COpts)),
 1108:     RawOpts = [{raw, SolSocket, SoReuseaddr, 4}],
 1109:     {ok,[{raw,SolSocket,SoReuseaddr,LRes}]} = inet:getopts(L, RawOpts),
 1110:     LReuseaddr = case nintbin2int(LRes) of
 1111:                      0 -> false;
 1112:                      _ -> true
 1113:                  end,
 1114:     {ok,[{raw,SolSocket,SoReuseaddr,CRes}]} = inet:getopts(L, RawOpts),
 1115:     CReuseaddr = case nintbin2int(CRes) of
 1116:                      0 -> false;
 1117:                      _ -> true
 1118:                  end,
 1119:     gen_tcp:close(L),
 1120:     gen_tcp:close(A),
 1121:     gen_tcp:close(C),
 1122:     {LReuseaddr, CReuseaddr}.
 1123: 
 1124: 
 1125: all_ok([]) ->
 1126:     true;
 1127: all_ok([H|T]) when H >= 0 ->
 1128:     all_ok(T);
 1129: all_ok(_) ->
 1130:     false.
 1131: 
 1132: 
 1133: make_check_fun(Config, Type) ->
 1134:     fun({Name,V1,V2,Mand,Chang},Acc) ->
 1135:             {LO1,CO1} = case Type of
 1136:                             connect -> {[],[{Name,V1}]};
 1137:                             _ -> {[{Name,V1}],[]}
 1138:                         end,
 1139:             {LO2,CO2} = case Type of
 1140:                             connect -> {[],[{Name,V2}]};
 1141:                             _ -> {[{Name,V2}],[]}
 1142:                         end,
 1143: 	    {X1,Y1,Z1} = create_socketpair_init(Config, LO1, CO1),
 1144: 	    {X2,Y2,Z2} = create_socketpair_init(Config, LO2, CO2),
 1145:             {S1,S2} = case Type of
 1146:                           listen -> {X1,X2};
 1147:                           accept -> {Y1,Y2};
 1148:                           connect -> {Z1,Z2}
 1149:                       end,
 1150: 	    {ok,[{Name,R1}]} = inet:getopts(S1,[Name]),
 1151: 	    {ok,[{Name,R2}]} = inet:getopts(S2,[Name]),
 1152: 	    NewAcc =
 1153: 		case R1 =/= R2 of
 1154: 		    true ->
 1155: 			case Chang of
 1156: 			    true ->
 1157: 				inet:setopts(S1,[{Name,V2}]),
 1158: 				{ok,[{Name,R3}]} =
 1159: 				    inet:getopts(S1,[Name]),
 1160: 				case {R3 =/= R1, R3 =:= R2} of
 1161: 				    {true,true} ->
 1162: 					Acc;
 1163: 				    _ ->
 1164: 					case Mand of
 1165: 					    true ->
 1166: 						exit
 1167: 						  ({failed_sockopt,
 1168: 						    {change,
 1169: 						     Name}});
 1170: 					    false ->
 1171: 						[{change,Name}|Acc]
 1172: 					end
 1173: 				end;
 1174: 			    false ->
 1175: 				Acc
 1176: 			end;
 1177: 		    false ->
 1178: 			case Mand of
 1179: 			    true ->
 1180: 				exit({failed_sockopt,
 1181: 				      {Type,Name}});
 1182: 			    false ->
 1183: 				[{Type,Name}|Acc]
 1184: 			end
 1185: 		end,
 1186: 	    gen_tcp:close(X1),
 1187: 	    gen_tcp:close(Y1),
 1188: 	    gen_tcp:close(Z1),
 1189: 	    gen_tcp:close(X2),
 1190: 	    gen_tcp:close(Y2),
 1191: 	    gen_tcp:close(Z2),
 1192: 	    NewAcc
 1193:     end.
 1194: 
 1195: make_check_fun(_Config) ->
 1196:     fun ({Name,V1,V2,Mand,Chang} = Spec, Acc) ->
 1197:             try
 1198:                 {ok,S1} = gen_udp:open(0, [{Name,V1}]),
 1199:                 {ok,S2} = gen_udp:open(0, [{Name,V2}]),
 1200:                 try
 1201:                     {ok,[{Name,R1}]} = inet:getopts(S1, [Name]),
 1202:                     {ok,[{Name,R2}]} = inet:getopts(S2, [Name]),
 1203:                     case R1 =/= R2 of
 1204:                         true ->
 1205:                             case Chang of
 1206:                                 true ->
 1207:                                     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{Name,V2}]),
 1208:                                     {ok,[{Name,R3}]} =
 1209:                                         inet:getopts(S1, [Name]),
 1210:                                     if
 1211:                                         R3 =/= R1, R3 =:= R2 ->
 1212:                                             Acc;
 1213:                                         true ->
 1214:                                             case Mand of
 1215:                                                 true ->
 1216:                                                     exit(
 1217:                                                       {failed_sockopt,
 1218:                                                        {change,Name}});
 1219:                                                 false ->
 1220:                                                     [{change,Name}|Acc]
 1221:                                             end
 1222:                                     end;
 1223:                                 false ->
 1224:                                     Acc
 1225:                             end;
 1226:                         false ->
 1227:                             case Mand of
 1228:                                 true ->
 1229:                                     exit({failed_sockopt, {udp,Name}});
 1230:                                 false ->
 1231:                                     [{udp,Name}|Acc]
 1232:                             end
 1233:                     end
 1234:                 after
 1235:                     gen_udp:close(S1),
 1236:                     gen_udp:close(S2)
 1237:                 end
 1238:             catch Class : Reason : Stacktrace ->
 1239:                     erlang:raise(Class, {fail,Reason,Spec}, Stacktrace)
 1240:             end
 1241:     end.
 1242: 
 1243: %% {OptionName,Value1,Value2,Mandatory,Changeable}
 1244: all_listen_options() ->
 1245:     OsType = os:type(),
 1246:     OsVersion = os:version(),
 1247:     [{tos,0,1,false,true}, 
 1248:      {priority,0,1,false,true}, 
 1249:      {reuseaddr,false,true,mandatory_reuseaddr(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1250:      {reuseport,false,true,mandatory_reuseport(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1251:      {reuseport_lb,false,true,mandatory_reuseport_lb(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1252:      {exclusiveaddruse,false,true,mandatory_exclusiveaddruse(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1253:      {keepalive,false,true,true,true}, 
 1254:      {linger, {false,10}, {true,10},true,true},
 1255:      {sndbuf,2048,4096,false,true}, 
 1256:      {recbuf,2048,4096,false,true}, 
 1257:      {nodelay,false,true,true,true},
 1258:      {header,2,4,true,true}, 
 1259:      {active,false,true,true,false}, 
 1260:      {packet,2,4,true,true}, 
 1261:      {buffer,1000,2000,true,true}, 
 1262:      {mode,list,binary,true,true}, 
 1263:      {deliver,term,port,true,true}, 
 1264:      {exit_on_close, true, false, true, true},
 1265:      {high_watermark,4096,8192,true,true}, 
 1266:      {low_watermark,2048,4096,true,true}, 
 1267:      {high_msgq_watermark,4096,8192,true,true}, 
 1268:      {low_msgq_watermark,2048,4096,true,true}, 
 1269:      {send_timeout,infinity,1000,true,true},
 1270:      {send_timeout_close,false,true,true,true},
 1271:      {delay_send,false,true,true,true}, 
 1272:      {packet_size,0,4,true,true}
 1273:     ].
 1274: 
 1275: all_accept_options() ->
 1276:     A0 = lists:keydelete(exclusiveaddruse, 1, all_listen_options()),
 1277:     A1 = lists:keydelete(reuseaddr, 1, A0),
 1278:     A2 = lists:keydelete(reuseport, 1, A1),
 1279:     lists:keydelete(reuseport_lb, 1, A2).
 1280: 
 1281: all_connect_options() ->
 1282:     OsType = os:type(),
 1283:     OsVersion = os:version(),
 1284:     [{tos,0,1,false,true}, 
 1285:      {priority,0,1,false,true}, 
 1286:      {reuseaddr,false,true,mandatory_reuseaddr(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1287:      {reuseport,false,true,mandatory_reuseport(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1288:      {reuseport_lb,false,true,mandatory_reuseport_lb(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1289:      {exclusiveaddruse,false,true,mandatory_exclusiveaddruse(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1290:      {keepalive,false,true,true,true}, 
 1291:      {linger, {false,10}, {true,10},true,true},
 1292:      {sndbuf,2048,4096,false,true}, 
 1293:      {recbuf,2048,4096,false,true}, 
 1294:      {nodelay,false,true,true,true},
 1295:      {header,2,4,true,true}, 
 1296:      {active,false,true,true,false}, 
 1297:      {packet,2,4,true,true}, 
 1298:      {buffer,1000,2000,true,true}, 
 1299:      {mode,list,binary,true,true}, 
 1300:      {deliver,term,port,true,true}, 
 1301:      {exit_on_close, true, false, true, true},
 1302:      {high_watermark,4096,8192,false,true}, 
 1303:      {low_watermark,2048,4096,false,true}, 
 1304:      {high_msgq_watermark,4096,8192,true,true}, 
 1305:      {low_msgq_watermark,2048,4096,true,true}, 
 1306:      {send_timeout,infinity,1000,true,true},
 1307:      {send_timeout_close,false,true,true,true},
 1308:      {delay_send,false,true,true,true}, 
 1309:      {packet_size,0,4,true,true}
 1310:     ].

 1312: 
 1313: all_udp_options() ->
 1314:     OsType = os:type(),
 1315:     OsVersion = os:version(),
 1316:     [{tos,0,1,false,true},
 1317:      {priority,0,1,false,true},
 1318:      {reuseaddr,false,true,mandatory_reuseaddr(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1319:      {reuseport,false,true,mandatory_reuseport(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1320:      {reuseport_lb,false,true,mandatory_reuseport_lb(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1321:      {exclusiveaddruse,false,true,
 1322:       mandatory_exclusiveaddruse(OsType,OsVersion),false},
 1323:      {sndbuf,2048,4096,false,true},
 1324:      {recbuf,2048,4096,false,true},
 1325:      {header,2,4,true,true},
 1326:      {active,false,true,true,false},
 1327:      {buffer,1000,2000,true,true},
 1328:      {mode,list,binary,true,true},
 1329:      {deliver,term,port,true,true},
 1330:      {broadcast,true,false,true,true},
 1331:      {dontroute,true,false,
 1332:       lists:member(OsType, [{unix,linux},{unix,freebsd},{unix,darwin}]),
 1333:       true},
 1334:      %% multicast_if
 1335:      %% multicast_ttl
 1336:      %% multicast_loop
 1337:      %% add_membership
 1338:      %% drop_membership
 1339:      {read_packets,6,7,true,true},
 1340:      {high_msgq_watermark,4096,8192,true,true},
 1341:      {low_msgq_watermark,2048,4096,true,true}].
 1342: 
 1343: 
 1344: %% Mandatory on a lot of system other than those listed below. Please add more...
 1345: mandatory_reuseaddr({unix, linux}, _OsVersion) ->
 1346:     true;
 1347: mandatory_reuseaddr({unix, freebsd}, _OsVersion) ->
 1348:     true;
 1349: mandatory_reuseaddr({unix, darwin}, _OsVersion) ->
 1350:     true;
 1351: mandatory_reuseaddr({win32, _}, _OsVersion) ->
 1352:     true; %% reuseaddr and reuseport are emulated by the inet-driver
 1353: mandatory_reuseaddr(_OsType, _OsVersion) ->
 1354:     false.
 1355: 
 1356: %% Mandatory an a lot of system other than those listed below. Please add more...
 1357: mandatory_reuseport({win32, _}, _OsVersion) ->
 1358:     true; %% reuseaddr and reuseport are emulated by the inet-driver
 1359: mandatory_reuseport({unix, linux}, {X,Y,_Z}) when X > 4 orelse X == 4 andalso Y >= 6 ->
 1360:     true;
 1361: mandatory_reuseport({unix, freebsd}, {X,Y,_Z}) when X > 11 orelse X == 11 andalso Y >= 4 ->
 1362:     %% I know that it is available on 11.4, but it may be available earlier...
 1363:     true;
 1364: mandatory_reuseport({unix, darwin}, {X,Y,_Z}) when X > 26 orelse X == 26 andalso Y >= 6 ->
 1365:     %% I know that it is available on 26.6, but it may be available earlier...
 1366:     true;
 1367: mandatory_reuseport(_OsType, _OsVersion) ->
 1368:     false.
 1369: 
 1370: %% Perhaps mandatory an system other than those listed below. Please add more...
 1371: mandatory_reuseport_lb({unix, linux}, {X,Y,_Z}) when X > 4 orelse X == 4 andalso Y >= 6 ->
 1372:     true;
 1373: mandatory_reuseport_lb({unix, freebsd}, {X,Y,_Z}) when X > 13 orelse X == 13 andalso Y >= 1 ->
 1374:     %% I know that it is available on 13.1, but it may be available earlier...
 1375:     true;
 1376: mandatory_reuseport_lb(_OsType, _OsVersion) ->
 1377:     false.
 1378: 
 1379: mandatory_exclusiveaddruse({win32, _}, {X,Y,_Z}) when X > 5 orelse X == 5 andalso Y >= 2 ->
 1380:     true;
 1381: mandatory_exclusiveaddruse(_OsType, _OsVersion) ->
 1382:     false.
 1383: 
 1384: create_socketpair_init(Config, ListenOptions, ConnectOptions) ->
 1385:     {ok,LS}   = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, ListenOptions),
 1386:     {ok,Port} = inet:port(LS),
 1387:     {ok,CS}   = ?CONNECT(Config, localhost, Port, ConnectOptions),
 1388:     {ok,AS}   = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
 1389:     {LS,AS,CS}.
 1390: 
 1391: create_socketpair(Config, ListenOptions, ConnectOptions) ->
 1392:     {LS,AS,CS} = create_socketpair_init(Config, ListenOptions, ConnectOptions),
 1393:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
 1394:     {AS,CS}.
 1395: 
 1396: 
 1397: start_helper(Config) ->
 1398:     Progname = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "sockopt_helper"),
 1399:     Port = open_port({spawn,Progname},[eof,line]),
 1400:     Port.
 1401: 
 1402: ask_helper(Port,Code) ->
 1403:     Com = integer_to_list(Code)++"\n",
 1404:     Port ! {self(),{command,Com}},
 1405:     receive
 1406: 	{Port,{data,{eol,Text}}} ->
 1407: 	    list_to_integer(Text);
 1408: 	Other ->
 1409: 	    exit({error,{unexpected_data_from_helper,Other}})
 1410:     after 3000 ->
 1411: 	    exit({error,helper_timeout})
 1412:     end.
 1413: 
 1414: stop_helper(Port) ->
 1415:     catch ask_helper(Port,?C_QUIT),
 1416:     receive
 1417: 	{Port,eof} ->
 1418: 	    Port ! {self(), close},
 1419: 	    receive
 1420: 		{Port,closed} ->
 1421: 		    ok
 1422: 	    after 1000 ->
 1423: 		    timeout
 1424: 	    end
 1425:     after 1000 ->
 1426: 	    timeout
 1427:     end.
 1428: 
 1429: binarify(Size,Binary) when Binary =:= true ->
 1430:     <<0:Size/unit:8>>;
 1431: binarify(Size,Binary) when Binary =:= false ->
 1432:     Size.
 1433: 
 1434: 
 1435: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1436: 
 1437: %% Here are all the *general* test case condition functions.
 1438: 
 1439: is_not_openbsd() ->
 1440:     is_not_platform(openbsd, "OpenBSD").
 1441: 
 1442: is_not_platform(Platform, PlatformStr)
 1443:   when is_atom(Platform) andalso is_list(PlatformStr) ->
 1444:       case os:type() of
 1445:           {unix, Platform} ->
 1446:               skip("This does not work on " ++ PlatformStr);
 1447:         _ ->
 1448:             ok
 1449:     end.
 1450: 
 1451: 
 1452: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1453: 
 1454: skip(Reason) ->
 1455:     throw({skip, Reason}).
 1456: 
 1457: 
 1458: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1459: 
 1460: links() ->
 1461:     pi(links).
 1462: 
 1463: monitors() ->
 1464:     pi(monitors).
 1465: 
 1466: pi(Item) ->
 1467:     {Item, Val} = process_info(self(), Item),
 1468:     Val.
 1469:
